Name: carbon disulfide production, from charcoal | carbon disulfide | EN15804GD, U

Description: The technology used in this dataset is the production of CS2 by sulphurization of charcoal.;In retort plants, molten sulfur is heated and vaporized either before or after addition to the retort. Reaction between the sulfur vapor and a stationary bed of charcoal at 850 – 900 °C takes place inside the retort at slightly above atmospheric pressure. The product gas, consisting of carbon disulfide, some sulfur, hydrogen sulfide, carbonyl sulfide, and inerts, passes through a train of condenser, scrubber, and oil absorber where the crude carbon disulfide is recovered; the pure product is obtained by further treatment in distillation columns. The yields are below 90%.;Electrical resistance heating in brick-lined electrothermal reactors provides an alternative heat source for the reaction of charcoal with sulfur.
